intro: Rubus nitidus var. coaltispinus, commonly known as the coal spiny blackberry, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically dark purple to black in color. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in the understory of forests. Its botanical features make it identifiable by its unique spines and clustered fruit structure.
